title: Brews, comfort foods the stars of Cheesetoberfest
text:

Join the Conversation Pulp Culture Ryan Cormier , The News Journal 2:42 p.m. EDT October 7, 2015 
The Scott Davidson Trio will team up with Indian classical musicians Snehasish Mozumder (mandolin) and Rajendra Das (tabla) at the baby grand in Wilmington this weekend. (Photo: Submitted photo) 
Not only will Indian and Arabic music mix with jazz and funk at the baby grand (818 N. Market St., Wilmington) Saturday, but a Wilmington musician will be getting a much-needed lift. 
Scott Davidson and his trio will team up with Indian classical musicians Snehasish Mozumder (mandolin) and Rajendra Das (tabla) for a night of music billed as an “East meets West Fusion concert.” 
Davidson, a percussionist, plays with Roger Mgrdichian (oud) and Lloyd Shorter (oboe, English horn) in his trio. 
The 8 p.m. show is more than a melding of music from around the world for Davidson, who is suffering from kidney failure and is in need of a kidney transplant. Proceeds from the show will go to his transplant fund. 
Tickets are $24 at the box office, by calling 652-5577 or going to thegrandwilmington.org . 
Contact Ryan Cormier of The News Journal at rcormier@delawareonline.com or (302) 324-2863. Follow him on Facebook ( @ryancormier ), Twitter ( @ryancormier ) and Instagram ( @ryancormier ). Read or Share this story: http://delonline.us/1Lizc6N Most Popular
